p: A surprising finding was that FT1 was involved in high temperature-induced (24 °C) bud flushing (Additional file 1: Figure S2). As GA 4 induces bud burst [ 40], and is required for elongation growth, it is tempting to speculate that a network including FT1 and GA-regulated 1,3-β-glucanases drives high-temperature induced premature bud flushing. Meristem transitions triggered by temperature elevation could be more general, as in Arabidopsis a moderate increase from 23 °C to 27 °C upregulated FT and induced flowering under short photoperiod [ 63].
